GHPM 0.0.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

Intro to GHPM

Harsh Baid

ghpm.Rmd

GHPM is an R Package designed to make grabbing data from a Github Repository and performing analytics easy. It does this by providing a set of flexible functions that query important aspects of a repository (pullrequests, commits, issues, etc..) via the Github API and pipes the output into dataframes.

We can then use the powerful data manipulation tools that dplyr provides to create a resulting dataframe of the information we want.

This document is designed to introduce you to some of these functions and the analytical data that can be extracted. To explore this functionality, we will be using RStudio’s Shiny repository to grab data from.

Issues

Lets start with grabbing issues from shiny repo using the following command.

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny")
#> # A tibble: 286 x 6
#>    issue title                 body                 creator milestone state
#>    <dbl> <chr>                 <chr>                <chr>   <chr>     <chr>
#>  1     1 support additional c… "Our slider control… jjalla… <NA>      CLOS…
#>  2     2 implement multipleSe… ""                   jjalla… <NA>      CLOS…
#>  3     3 implement radioGroup… ""                   jjalla… <NA>      CLOS…
#>  4     4 head deduplication s… "Line-oriented dedu… jcheng5 <NA>      CLOS…
#>  5     5 single HTML widget i… ""                   jjalla… <NA>      CLOS…
#>  6     6 slider does not work… ""                   jjalla… 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  7     7 improve adaptive ren… "Previous and next … jjalla… 0.10.0    CLOS…
#>  8     8 "custom UI html not … "I've tried custom … hafen   <NA>      CLOS…
#>  9     9 Feature request: Abi… ""                   jcheng5 <NA>      CLOS…
#> 10    10 Plots in tabsets not… "Hello,\nIf one mov… agalec… <NA>      CLOS…
#> # … with 276 more rows

However, depending on the information I am looking for, I can further refine my request. If I only wanted issues from a particular milestone that were closed, I could do the following:

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(milestone == "0.9.0", state == "CLOSED")
#> # A tibble: 16 x 6
#>    issue title                body                  creator milestone state
#>    <dbl> <chr>                <chr>                 <chr>   <chr>     <chr>
#>  1     6 slider does not wor… ""                    jjalla… 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  2    14 Input variable leng… After looking at the… keaven  0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  3    21 singleton and tags$… singleton and tags$h… jcheng5 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  4    25 Provide an easy way… ""                    jcheng5 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  5    29 Scrollbar in sidebar It would be useful t… wch     0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  6    31 formatting for nume… "I'm playing with a … HarlanH 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  7    42 all-or-nothing sele… Would love the check… HarlanH 0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  8    43 Tutorial/examples n… "Hi -\nexample2 and … arc12   0.9.0     CLOS…
#>  9    60 Remove http://rstud… This URL used to sto… wch     0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 10    66 Date/Time sliders    Often there is a nee… aplavin 0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 11    82 reload server.R and… "Perhaps as an optio… vnijs   0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 12    90 Example 03_reactivi… "https://groups.goog… jcheng5 0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 13    98 runApp() opens inco… "Absolutely loving S… ericha… 0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 14   111 selectInput: choice… "\"selected\" in sel… dmenne  0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 15   119 sliderInput treats … as.character is used… jcheng5 0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 16   129 renderTable gives e… "The root of the pro… wch     0.9.0     CLOS…

or say I wanted to only get issues that a certain user created for a specific milestone

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(creator == "HarlanH", milestone == "0.9.0")
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   issue title             body                      creator milestone state
#>   <dbl> <chr>             <chr>                     <chr>   <chr>     <chr>
#> 1    31 formatting for n… "I'm playing with a litt… HarlanH 0.9.0     CLOS…
#> 2    42 all-or-nothing s… Would love the checkboxG… HarlanH 0.9.0     CLOS…

I can get even more information by combining this query with other issue based queries. Like if I wanted to get the comments of all the issues created by user: HarlanH that were assigned in the 0.9.0 milestone, I could do:

HarlanH_issues <- get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(creator == "HarlanH", milestone == "0.9.0")

get_issue_comments("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(issue %in% HarlanH_issues$issue)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 4
#>   issue comment                                 author  date               
#>   <int> <chr>                                   <chr>   <dttm>             
#> 1    31 But what if I want scientific notation… spgarb… 2016-06-17 15:17:39
#> 2    31 You could check out the work-around I … bborge… 2016-06-17 17:58:42
#> 3    31 "I'm closing this because the original… alandi… 2019-04-25 18:29:22
#> 4    42 "I think you can achieve this by updat… yihui   2014-01-10 23:47:23
#> 5    42 I love this! An elegant solution!       yanshil 2017-03-13 03:29:32
#> 6    42 "Could it be relevant to reopen that s… larmar… 2018-11-29 15:05:15

The following functions are provided to grab issue data

  • get_issues() - Grabs general data about each issue
  • get_issue_labels() - Grabs the labels attached to each issue
  • get_issue_assignees() - Grabs assignees assigned to each issue
  • get_issue_events() - Queries event data specific to issues being added and moved across project boards for each issue
  • get_issue_comments() - Grabs the comment data for each issue.

Pull Requests

Pull requests is another area where GHPM has a lot of flexibility. To just grab some basic information about pull requests, I can do the following:

get_all_pull_requests("rstudio", "shiny")
#> # A tibble: 100 x 10
#>    pullrequest title author body  milestone created_at          merged_by
#>          <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>    
#>  1          12 fixe… jeffr… just… <NA>      2012-08-17 23:13:14 jcheng5  
#>  2          28 Chan… wch    Usin… <NA>      2012-10-30 15:50:29 jcheng5  
#>  3          32 "sma… edwin… "Hi … <NA>      2012-11-08 22:20:09 jcheng5  
#>  4          49 For … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-03 21:00:57 jcheng5  
#>  5          50 Use … wch    This… <NA>      2012-12-03 21:02:35 <NA>     
#>  6          51 Allo… wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-05 20:22:35 <NA>     
#>  7          62 Meth… wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-19 19:52:32 <NA>     
#>  8          63 Wrap… wch    "The… <NA>      2012-12-20 06:37:09 <NA>     
#>  9          68 Add … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2013-01-04 21:49:29 <NA>     
#> 10          69 Fix … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2013-01-08 03:20:41 <NA>     
#> # … with 90 more rows, and 3 more variables: merged_at <dttm>,
#> #   merged_to <chr>, state <chr>

or a more refined search of pull requests grabbing the ones that were created by a specific user and merged.

dd <- get_all_pull_requests("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(author == "wch", state == "MERGED")

I can also grab the commit history of specific pull requests

get_pull_request_commits("rstudio", "shiny", 271)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 4
#>   oid              message                     author   date               
#>   <chr>            <chr>                       <chr>    <dttm>             
#> 1 aab2cce97858f9a… Update to Bootstrap 2.3.2   Winston… 2013-10-15 17:13:34
#> 2 559c6722ff5741e… Update NEWS                 Winston… 2013-10-15 20:24:02
#> 3 2e60f2b2ce8e040… Update to jQuery 1.10.2     Winston… 2013-11-19 20:35:53
#> 4 9725b23db1588f6… Update NEWS                 Winston… 2013-11-19 20:36:21
#> 5 7ca22a871892879… "Add updated version of js… Winston… 2013-11-19 22:36:39

and even have the option to parse them into a conventional commits format

get_pull_request_commits("rstudio", "shiny", 271, .cc = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 7
#>   oid       type  description   body      footer author date               
#>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>         <chr>     <chr>  <chr>  <dttm>             
#> 1 aab2cce9… <NA>  Update to Bo… <NA>      <NA>   Winst… 2013-10-15 17:13:34
#> 2 559c6722… <NA>  Update NEWS   <NA>      <NA>   Winst… 2013-10-15 20:24:02
#> 3 2e60f2b2… <NA>  Update to jQ… <NA>      <NA>   Winst… 2013-11-19 20:35:53
#> 4 9725b23d… <NA>  Update NEWS   <NA>      <NA>   Winst… 2013-11-19 20:36:21
#> 5 7ca22a87… <NA>  Add updated … This add… <NA>   Winst… 2013-11-19 22:36:39
